Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, beautiful interior”
Reviews.Author: PaulinaDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in March. Location a little outside city centre but bus and metro stops close by + Rome is a big city so you'll do a lot of walking anyways. Very helpful and friendly staff with fluent English. Loved the interior design, rooms cleaned everyday, toiletries re-stocked. Nice breakfast. Cosy terrace on the roof top + a jacuzzi which must be gorgeous in summer. Supermarket, quite a few restaurants, Irish pub nearby. Would defo stay there again. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fab weekend in Rome, great quality, clean & amazing breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: julie b
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Rome. The location worried me slightly on arrival in the taxi as the sign for the hotel is slighty dated and 'old school' but was pleasantly supprised once inside. The reception staff where most hepfull and as we arrived early our room was not ready so we left our bags and returned later in the afternoon. we were then upgraded to a room with a terrace on the 4th floor which was fab. Room was a little small but lots of cupboard space with hangers etc. The bathroom was extremley clean and there were all the usual little extras like shower gel etc. Only downside was that the walls are 'very' thin so you can hear 'everything'...... Breakfast was AMAZING, make sure you go down with plenty of time so you can go back for more and more!! Yes you will come home a stone heavier than you went! Overall a fab hotel, we didn't use any public transport as we walked into the centre which took no longer than 20 mins to spanish steps. An amazing little italian restaurant 2mins away (out the main doors to the end of the road and take a left, you will see on your right) The hotel also arranged our taxi which was a blacked out chauffer Merc for our return to the airport (50 euro) In general Rome is very expensive so would advise bringing few extra euro's so you can make the most of the great food and wine. would stay again. Highly recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: adrianamh
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Fiume for 2 nights in Feb 2012. Our flight got us into Rome early and we were at the hotel by 10 am. Our rooms weren't ready yet, but we were graciously allowed to eat breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. The hotel and rooms are very modern and nicely decorated. The rooms were quite noise-proof and we did not hear any of the sounds on the street below. The hotel is within a 5-7 min walking distance from a metro station and there are many bus stops close by. The hotel is located just outside Porta Pia, one of the "doors" to the inner city. The front desk staff was great - Alessandro made some great restaurant suggestions. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality!”
Reviews.Author: marko002002
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with perfect design in lounge, hotel staff was very professional. Hotel is 10/15 min from Via Veneto, Spanish Steps by foot, or 2 min by taxi and there are good bars just outside a hotel. Breakfast was OK, nothing special, rooms were quite big (even for a single room) and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Well-ordered and professional”
Reviews.Author: Colour-Professor
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fiume is not grand, but provides many benefits. The reception staff are highly professional and courteous, the rooms are clean and well organised, and the small lounge is comfortable with an obliging hostess behind the bar. The breakfast was first rate. The only downsides were that neither the reception level nor the breakfast room were at the same level as the lift, but were both up flights of about 8 steps, which makes it difficult for anyone with walking difficulties. Also there is no hotel restaurant for evening meals. The Villa Borghese is within walking distance and all the attractions of the historic centre are within a short cab ride. There are several good restaurants in the surrounding streets. This is the civilised face of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfasts and good rooom - quiite far from metro”
Reviews.Author: jonathan_smoker
Reviews.Content: Hello, My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in June 2011 and overall it was great. Positives: o The breakfasts were really excellent, the best we had all year and we visited many hotels. o The room was clean, not really small although it did have a musty smell likely due to previous ocupants smoking and/or latent humidity in the air that in some ways is unavoidable I guess. We asked for a change of room and it was granted quickly. o We paid about 130 Euros a night for a double room that I think is good value. o There are some very nice places to eat nearby. o The staff spoke good English and some of them Spanish. o No problem with leaving luggage for some hours on the last day of our stay. o The cleaners were friendly! Negatives: o It is a bit of a walk (15 minutes) to the Metro although there is a bus you can take to Tivoli station. o We found the attitide of one of the receptionists quite distant and rude to one of the other staff members who was helping us with our bags. The other one was fine. Maybe he was just having a bad day as we all do! Overall we would certainly go back. Jonathan.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: x_509
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't write much in this review, just simple comments - Amazing Service - Amazing Staff - Clean I would recommend this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jesy_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very helpful and courteous with sight seeing and making suggestions for dinner or shopping. The bathroom with a small tub was one of our largest bathrooms of our trip to Italy. Walking distance to Borghese and other sights and accessible with public buses or Number 19 Tram. Slightly quieter area than locations near Roma Termini and a walk through Borghese gardens is a nice escape. Very nice breakfast room and good assortment of foods. This hotel is too far from local Rome Termini or Metro for easy access. So unless you prefer a taxi or bus it is some distance to travel with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Fiume. The hotel is a little outside the main tourist areas (which was ok by us). The taxi stand and bus stop is nearby; however, we mostly walked everywhere. It's about a 20-25 minute walk from Piazza Navona. The room was large with a very comfortable bed and contemporary furnishings. I would have liked to have a little more light in the room for at night. The front desk staff was very helpful and gave us tips for sights to see in our short trip. All-in-all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Shani81
Reviews.Content: Clean, Well-designed, very kind and helpful staff, very close to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Small Room, otherwise nice”
Reviews.Author: YasmineNassar
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff aren't that helpful, tiny rooms, tiny shower cabin, tiny elevator, average location, we used to get around by bus... However it's a walking distance to Galleria Borghese, must see! I'd stay there again after all, Hotel is clean, nice breakfast, and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kermitpise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a combination of leisure and business (total 3 nights). Extremely satisfied with the quality of the infrastructure itself and the very professional staff. Very nice room. Brilliant bed, bathroom, power shower. One of the cleanest hotels I have ever been. Impeccable. Good location, just around the corner from Villa Borghese and quite well connected with public transport. Also10 mins taxi drive to the historic centre.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky little hotel but lovely room and good quiet location”
Reviews.Author: purpleprincess33
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after many hours searching on the internet. I wanted a hotel that was not too close to Termni (which isn't nice at night) and offered value and comfort. Fiume offers all. About 10 minutes from the city centre, we used buses and metros very successfully in the daytime to traverse the city and taxis at night for speed and security. The hotel is in a nice quiet area with a good selection of bars and restaurants nearby if you don't want to travel into the city centre at night. Taxis are well priced. Apart from the first receptionist on our arrival who was most unwelcoming, bordering on rude, the rest of the reception and hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are well renovated in a modern and very comfortable style. Breakfast was very comprehensive and included in the price. The hotel has free wifi and the staff were helpful in guiding us and booking restaurants. I would recommened this hotel to couples and individuals for short stays or business trips. Not for families I think.

Reviews.Title: “Travel to Rome”
Reviews.Author: pnm8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Fuime Hotel, Rome, Italy in September and would definitely recommend it. The room was newly decorated with a nice bathroom and big shower. The room was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful in navigating the city. The breakfast buffet was great with hot and cold items. The hotel is in a nice area, about 1 mile from the main train station, and is very accessible to all touristy areas by city bus. We purchased a three day Roma Pass for unlimited bus and metro rides.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: Greg B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and we got some bad advice from the reception on multiple occasions. The room was great except the shower leaked like crazy when in use. The breakfast was the best we had in italy out of 5 hotels. It was a little further from the action of rome then we would have preferred.

Reviews.Title: ““Perfect hotel, convenient location””
Reviews.Author: Evelynkhor80
Reviews.Content: Fiume Hotel was a great place to stay on my frist trip to Rome. Although it's a little ways away from the major sites, that makes it nice. It is close to the bus and train station. This hotel close to Castro Pretorio station and bus stop, but we took a taxi to hotel (ard 7 Euro). Can take bus no 62 to hot spot locations (1 Euro per ticket can ride for 75minutes). Lots of restaurants, fruit markets, deli, bakeries, and supermarkets around this hotel. The staff were outstanding, very helpful and spoke perfect English, and continental breakfast was excellent. The room big and a large bathroom and balcony. The room was very clean, comfortable, modern and stylishly designed with free wi-fi. The location was perfect for us. it was far from the madding crowd of the more touristy places. The trattorias around the corner were quite wonderful allowing us to eat amongst local families at reasonable prices. We could have easily way walked to some spots (exp: Piazza de spagna) I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not for children”
Reviews.Author: Trine0013
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location, walking distance to main attractions in Rome. Small hotel, but with large and very nicely furnished rooms. Breakfast was good. Staff was friendly and helpful. But this is not the hotel you should choose if you travel with children. You could easily notice that they did not appreciate children at all. The whole atmosphere indicated that this was a "adults only" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sharon_zz
Reviews.Content: Located in the neighborhood of "Porta Pia", very close to "villa Borghese", a lot of busses pass in this area and you can take one to Venice Square, The Spanish Stairs, Navona Square and all the other sites in Rome It is An easy 5 minute walk from the Burghese park and gallery. The lobby is very elegant, the entire hotel has undergone massive renovations and especially the lobby and the bar area has contemporary design. My room on the 4th floor had a small balcony, but it was too hot to seat and enjoy the roofs of the near by buildings. The room was not big but had a lot of light, nice decoration, and very cleans. I loved the modern bathroom and rainforest shower head. In room and Lobby areas had free Wi-Fi. The staff was very helpful, the reception clerk help with booking to the Vatican Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked Away”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenVegas
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful boutique hotel. It is about a 20 minute walk to the Via Veneto thorugh lovely neighborhoods (and once you know the way it's easy peasy!). We arrived at midnight, yes midnight and the man behind the desk was so nice. Checked us in quickly. Yes, there a some steps from the lobby to the elevator, but not to worry. The man that checked us in, carried our luggage up the stairs and I saw them help others with their luggage during our stay. Our rate included breakfast which was a mix of Italian & American. Scrambled eggs, pastries, breads, cold cuts and cheese, etc. My husband for the first time enjoyed the coffee in Europe saying it was almost like American coffee and not too strong. My only caveat...if you are tall, mind the arches in the breakfast room. You must look where you're walking. I saw several men not pay attention (my husband included) and they banged their heads on the low part of the archways. All in all, we would definitely stay here again and would tell others the same.

Reviews.Title: “Quality worth value”
Reviews.Author: UgisL
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Fiume as our honeymoon staying place and we were very satisfied! And here are some things we'd like to share: 1. Hotel is just few hundred meters outside the city center walls, so taxi driver might try to cheat you with the price... and even if the hotel is a bit outside the center, all of the most popular tourist objects are reachable by feet... And close to a very nice park! 2. Personnel at the reception was very kind and helpful - even late at night. 3. Breakfast: casual but good... just couldn't get used to the small coffee cups, but that's my problem - coffee was really good!:) 4. Room: Well, even if the room didn't look as big and great as on the photos, it was very, very nice. A lot of little things that matter! Special extras like a possibility to make a tea or coffee and a roof solarium with little fountain, two chairs with a small table at the doors of the room... Atmosphere was very cosy! Air conditioning worked a bit loud, but well.. 5. Room service: quite ok 6. The neighborhood is nice and quiet with small restaurants around the corner. The best was "I Molisani" 7. Would recommend for people who like excellent interior design!

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel very acceptable”
Reviews.Author: sid03
Reviews.Content: recently referb hotel, rooms small but all you need, done out to a high standard,breakfast nice,about 15 minutes walk to the spanish steps.May be considered a little way out if you want to be nearer centre for night life cost arround 96eur. Staff spoke english would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Management”
Reviews.Author: NJMJCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Disappointed, not the site, but its management, by written agreement with the price includes VAT, taxes and buffet breakfast I got an extra bill on departure of 102 € as the manager said was an additional tax which the city council had in place, but I had not been indformeret about this change, the written agreement in advance, only on departure was presented and my objection to the agreement included tax was rejected. So one must obviously not rely on a written agreement whereby the management after the introduction of this tax had 180 days to indformere me about a change in tax rules, The hotel is otherwise top

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: EJHILLHawaii
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at stay at Fiume Hotel. Our room was small but the balcony was almost as big. Very clean and the most comfortable bed and pillows we found in Italy. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Transient-friend
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel at north-eastern fringe of Rome city, close to Castro Pretorio station which is one stop away from Termini. With the metro in Rome all things amazing are within easy reach. Given how expensive Rome is and given most of the city is a tourist attraction, you are better off staying at the fringe within easy reach. Lots of restaurants, fruit markets, deli, bakeries, and supermarkets around this hotel. Breakfast is served daily and is inclusive in daily price of your room. Service was good. We had a small problem with our first room (a strange smell lingered in the room even with the windows open). They promptly set us up in another room which was a minor upgrade, at no extra charge. The hotel is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location, and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff1786
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fiume on the first stop of our honeymoon, and were blown away by it's value. A ten minute or less cab ride from Termini Station, the hotel staff was more than happy to check our bags before our check-in time so that we could explore Rome. 2 km from the Piazza Spagna and the Fontana di Trevi. An abundant breakfast was served every day, and the selection was phenomenal. Hotel front desk was available to answer any questions and to accommodate requests. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Una bella hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Allen_TXNzlover
Reviews.Content: Very large room ...my 10 yr old grandaughter commented " I want this for MY room at home" when we opened the door. Location is quiet, near the Villa Borghese and a short walk to the no. 60 and 62 bus stops which cover all the tourist sites. Taxis are 7-15 Euros to any of the sites as well. The continental breakfast was excellent and even included scrambled or hard boiled eggs and bacon. The staff were outstanding, very helpful and spoke perfect English and even coped well with my grammatically incorrect Italian. I would not hesitate for an instant to return to this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel in tranquil neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Losviages
Reviews.Content: A word that describes Hotel Fiume best is peaceful. I stayed here in April for an extended weekend when travelling together with my mum and we shared a room with twin bed. The room was very tidy with modern decor, but was very small. I had read similar comments from other travellers before our trip, so I was prepared for it and since it wasn't our intention to spend much time inside the room anyway, it didn't bother us that much. Although the hotel is rated four*, there were no special amenities in the room (slippers, bathrobes, mineral water), but the price of the room was very decent too, so it makes up for it. Our room was on the first floor and had a street view, but luckily no noise passed through the windows nor from the corridor. The bed, albeit a bit narrow for two, was really comfortable and that's something I highly value after a long day of walking around in Rome. Breakfast was well varied and tasty too, I was happy to notice they even served dark bread. The hotel itself is small (boutique style?) and had an almost etheric ambience, I hardly met any other hotel guests, except during breakfast and really, it was incredibly quiet there. Hotel Fiume is located a bit off the center, but in a tranquil and neat neighbourhood with a couple of nice and cheap Trattorias right behind the hotel corner. Upon our arrival to Rome, we walked to the hotel from Termini (we had very little lugagge), so it's a walkable distance away from the center (or at least from Termini), but it's still best to use public transportation to save your feet. The nearest metro station is actually rather far from the hotel, but busses run nearby, you just need to figure out which one goes where :) In essence, I do recommend Hotel Fiume. Just be prepared to spend some time each day walking to the bus stop or metro station and back + the time spend travelling in a bus or metro. Could I choose again, I might choose a hotel even closer to "the center", just to save some time, but on the upside, the local restaurants and cafes were significantly cheaper in this part of Rome and since I like to start my days jogging, the nearby Villa Borghese park offered good running grounds too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: daniellelouise32
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights in January and it was the most enjoyable stay I've ever had in a hotel. The hotel its self is located in a very good area but is a bit tricky to get to for the first time, I suggest taxi from Termani. Once you get use to the public transport there is nor problem what-so ever. The room we got was huge with two beds and a large bathroom. The room was very comfortable, modern and stylishly designed with free wi-fi. We got breakfast each morning in the hotel which was very good, just your normal European breakfast but tasty. The hotel staff were a pleasure to deal with and helped us out when trying to figure out which buses to get. If i was returning to Rome I would not hesitate to stay here again for one second. I highly recommend it, and may I say I am very picky about hotels but Hotel Fiume is fabulous. Also I highly advise a trip to the ice cram shop on the same block as the hotel, without a doubt the nicest ice cream I have ever tasted!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice when visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: FashionD
Reviews.Content: Fiume Hotel was a great place to stay on my recent trip to Rome. Although it's a little ways away from the major sites, that makes it nice. It is close to the bus and train station, too. We took a bus to the Colosseum our first morning and actually saw all the sites in one day and walked back to the hotel. It's a bit of a walk, but definitely doable. The complimentary breakfast and Internet is what makes this hotel stand out, too. The breakfast spread is beautiful. The dining area, as well as all the common areas are modern and well-decorated. A great gem in Rome. My only semi-complaint is the noise. We couldn't sleep with our window open because the traffic was too loud, despite it being on a relatively quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “A very impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: China50
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fiume will be our choice should we return to Rome. Located approximately 10-15m walk from the bus terminus, enough of a walk to take in the Roman way of life,passing where the locals live as well as other hotels, without being too tiring to prevent enjoyment of the rest of the day. We enjoyed a tasty and varied breakfast each morning after a good nights sleep at the hotel, walked to the terminus each morning to board the open top touring bus to set off around the sights of this beautiful city. This way we were able to choose which sights to enjoy at our leisure. We received help from the hotel staff with local restaurant choices, taxi hire and map reading. I can't praise them enough, from breakfast to bed time all the staff were friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The weather at this time of year is beautiful, perfect for long days walking. If we could offer a tip it would be to make sure you include a saturday and a sunday as part of your trip, some roads are closed to traffic and so sightseeing is a little less hectic. Also when you need to cross the road, go for it, don't wait - when in Rome do as the Romans do - step out into the road,the traffic WILL stop ! Honestly...

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Odr997
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my partner for a sightseeing trip. The hotel is not centrally located within Rome to give the best base to start from however this did not cause a problem whatsoever. Less than five minutes walk from the nearest tube station (which is the best way of getting about). Hotel provides an adequate continental breakfast with some hot food options, which is more than enough to get you through to lunchtime. The quality of the room we were provided with was exellent however a little on the small side so make sure you're tidy! We only had a shower which was a dissapointment as a long hard day walking deserved a soak in the bath, maybe this was the norm for a standard room? We found the room extremely hot (even with the air conditioning on) during the night time but not too unbareable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and warm”
Reviews.Author: FlaneurR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for three nights over Easter, with my husband. The hotel is very well decorated and squeaky clean. The service is very good, and the staff friendly and helpful. I had a few issues with my booking but everything went smoothly much to my relief. The location of the hotel is definitely not close to the main attractions but who like to live away from crowded areas and yet be within easy approach of the main attractions, this is it. I loved the breakfast spread, there is not so much of variety if not staying in a 5 star, the highlight was the freshly squeezed orange juice - best start to the morning! Also, as we are not meat eaters we had hot omlette for breakfast on request! Overall loved the hotel and the people!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Fiume!!!”
Reviews.Author: KMart3307
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! We were quite pleased with the services and quality of the hotel. The only downside was it was further from most sites we wanted to visit. We did, however, walk to everything, including Vatican City and Ancient Rome. Taking public transportation was too slow with all of the traffic. The hotel also referred us to a local restaurant right around the corner, which was fantastic. While the hotel is further out, you definitely reap the benefits of eating with the locals. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Fiume”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaJack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on 3/4-3/11. I stay in a room with a balcony that faces the street where the entrance is. The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom was nice and large for it's size. As a big fat American, I would say that there was not a ton of closet space. This would not normally be a problem but we were staying for a while and needed the room. The room was a little warm as the Italian gov controls a/c. We just opened the door to the balcony and it cooled instantly. We could have possibly saved money and not purchased a room with breakfast. The breakfast did not change and became tiring. There are tons of breakfast options around the hotel in walking distance so keep that in mind. I would say that there were no other problems than that. Oh, the wifi sucked as my only complaint. Thanks. PS Avoid Cous Cous restaurant down the sidewalk. They prey on tourists. We were so hungry from the trip and chose it to be quick. They instantly provided us a "one cost" meal price. We basically paid around $80 US for some beans and cous cous. The locals came in and were provided with a menu with tons of options. We noticed after we received our food. Just a heads-up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 4-star hotel in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFrequent
Reviews.Content: The inside of the hotel was fantastic: small but very clean rooms with very comfortable beds. The staff was super friendly, from the reception to the cleaning personnel (it is one of the few times I left a tip for the cleaning stafff while leaving). Prior to our arrival, I received an email from the hotel explaining how to get there from the aiport which was very helpful. The hotel is located in an upscale residential area, which is plesant to walk around and full of small local restaurants (after the first night, we ended up eating there for dinner because we were so tired after the day of walking and the value for money was better than in the center of the city). The only downside is that you need to take a bus to get anywhere (it is about a 15 min walk to Piazza de Spagnia and there is no metro stop) but the buses are frequent and we enjoyed the bus experience. All in all, a fantastic 4-star hotel with an excellent value for money. I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Andreas_Spinoulas
Reviews.Content: +Nice location not far from attractions. + Helpfull desk + Clean + New furnished - No free wifi - Size of rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomkat04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Fiume Hotel and came away impressed. The Hotel staff were friendly and helpful making us feel right at home. The room was clean with an adequate mini-bar filled stocked with essentials. (water, etc) The location of the hotel might be considered "out of the way" by some, however if you are looking for a Hotel in a residential neighborhood, this is your hotel. The hotel sits just outside the old outer walls of the city and is populated by locals. This is a major plus in my book as my wife and I like to "get away" from the tourist traps. This hotel is situated around various restaurants, all of which were very good. The pricing was spot on and considerably less than other restaurants closer to tourist destinations. Other Notes: great breakfast, local stores (clothing, food, pharmacy ect) close to the park Overall, I would reccommend this hotel to anyone looking to "get away" and wanting to enjoy one of Rome's local neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Teos_mom_28
Reviews.Content: It was a very good choise. Very good breakfast, quite at night, good service, very clean. However we've changed room (as soon as we asked for it) because of the noise of the bathroom pluming!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: NMonte
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a neighborhood so you are able to really get a feeling of "down home" Italy, as opposed to being in the tourist district. Front staff is very knowledgeable about bus transport. We worked with Ramon and Alessandro and they were incredible. They offer airport service for 15 Euro a person. Breakfast is an incredible spread. Only problem was that someone wanted to toss glass bottles every night around midnight for 15 minutes or so. Shutting the window fixed the problem.

Reviews.Title: “nice local hotel, nonamerican”
Reviews.Author: my3kidsmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a neighborhood so the restaurants around it are not touristy... a big plus.. better and cheaper food. But need to walk about 20 mins to center of all the sites. One of the front staff people gave us wrong directions and information just about every time. The other front staff was great, accurate, and informative. Great value for the money, very good breakfast, only downside was the room smelled like a dead animal in the ventilation system. We changed rooms and still smelled it. Smell disipated as the stay wore on but very unnerving..

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay”
Reviews.Author: birkheim
Reviews.Content: A modern, newly redecorated hotel in an oldfashioned body located near the Villa Bourghese. The surroundings were nice with lots of small restaurants and a luxurious warehouse nearby. Short trip to the city of Rome. Nice breakfast and serviceminded staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked the first night but then wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jemei
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night at 11pm and were told the hotel is overbooked. We were moved to another hotel nearby (Albani) which was OK. We were rather unhappy about this!! BUT the next day we left our luggage and spent the day in Rome. Our luggage was transferred to Fiume and as a gesture of good will we got the two rooms on top of the hotel. Lovely rooms, nice terrace with good view - so the last 2 nights were great. Breakfast was very good, staff really friendly. So as long as they get there bookings under control, this hotel is really nice for a stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “excellent accommodations; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mayette_2010
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed in Hotel Fiume with 3 other families. all were 1st time visitors to Rome. From the first day, the staff were very warmly welcoming and helpful with our endless questions about directions and bus stops. One staff willingly sold us his supply of bus tickets at cost when we went out too early in the day and the tobacco shop nearby was still closed. Grazie Alessandro! Grazie to Gian Carlo, as well - he graciously opened the breakfast bar 30 mins early a couple of times. Breakfast were free and scrumptious - eggs, ham,lots of fruits, pastries and cereal galore. Loved our rooms. One can tell that the place is newly renovated. the families with kids understandbly got bigger rooms. weirdly though some of the showers had shower doors that were not wide enough thus the wet floors ( we compared rooms obviously). The location was perfect for us. it was far from the madding crowd of the more touristy places. The trattorias around the corner were quite wonderful allowing us to eat amongst local families at reasonable prices. We did not mind having to take the bus to places. in fact we rather enjoyed getting to know the local rhythm of things that way. we could have easily walked to some spots but with kids in tow we decided to take public transport. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “hot, hot, hot..”
Reviews.Author: NiamhBridgit
Reviews.Content: Long weekend in Rome - the B&H hotel as mentioned in previous reviews it is not central, but in walking distance to some of the main attractions. This is a good thing, not to noisy and plenty of really good restaurants close by - no waiting for a table. The hotel was exactly like the photos advertised on their website. We had a deluxe room, for a few quid more it was worth it (more space, bigger bathroom, bath robes and a balcony). The staff were friendly and extremely helpful with everything - always a welcoming smile. I'll admit late July wasn't the best time to be walking around Rome, it was very hot, some shops were even closed as the locals take their holidays this time of year and head to the coast. Taxi fares were good (even they were complaining about the heat)- I wouldn't advise driving in the city, the rules of the road are quite different from anywhere else in the world. If ever in Rome again I would stay in the B&H hotel...happy holidays Oh and girls - don't pack case - shopping is much cheaper than I was informed(get off the main drags). So is eating out, then again Ireland is a complete rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: isisy
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Hotel Fiume during labor day weekend. Absolutely loved it. Here is my pro / con list of the hotel, which I find the most useful when evaluating a hotel Pro: most of the stuff speak very good English, and are nice and courteous. very clean room, I got a deluxe room that comes with the comfy robes and slippers. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom toiletry was very well stocked at all times. The bed is extremely comfortable, and the decor is very lovely. Breakfast buffet was one of the best I had in Italy. Very well cooked eggs, fresh slices of watermelon was served daily. We also stayed there with a couple other friends, and used the roof top nightly to drink wine. We bought our own bottles from the wine store and supermarkets (both are within one block radius from the hotel), and the hotel provided the glasses every night. There are also many local restaurants nearby, which for the most part are not the typical tourist traps (but Italians eat late, so don't show up at 7pm, no one is going to be there) Cons: If you want to be in the middle of all tourist actions, this is not the place for you. This place seems to be in the middle of the financial district for Rome, and therefore has more restaurants and shops for people living there locally. To get to most of the attractions, it's typically a 15 - 20 minutes walk, which for us was great. We never took the public transportation, even though many buses stop here. The subway station is about 10 minutes walk away from the hotel. but, there is a taxi stand (the only place where you can get a taxi, seems like) and is only 5 minutes away from the hotel. The room lighting overall is a bit dark. so, make sure you see yourself in the light before leaving your room. some of my friends had a room with a strange smell, but after talking to the hotel, they changed it for them the next day. The wi-fi was a bit annoying. It's free, but each card only works for 24 hours. So, you constantly have to ask for new cards. Although the concierge gives you no problem for getting new cards, it's just a bit annoying. I will stay here again if I were to visit Rome. I think it's reasonably priced, and very tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful birthday present”
Reviews.Author: fionamcg
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in this hotel with my husband and another couple it was a birthday present for us 2 ladies. The hotel was excellent, initially it would appear to be a little outside the city centre however, it is on the 62 bus route which went right through the centre and across to the vatican for 1 euro per journey or 4 euro for 24 hour ticket great value for travelling. We had a classic room which was exactly was shown on the website spotless, bright and queen size bed. The breakfast room was bright and modern with a good selection of food. The receptionist was very helpful and went out of his way to help us looking up bus routes on the internet. I would definately recommend using this hotel as a base for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: asb5522
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights last week and it was quite a wonderful place. The location is one of the advantages, its opposite is a bakery which also sells some side dishes and roast meats, a true locality. Also, it is about five or ten minutes walk to the nearest metro station and only one station to Termini. Plus there are many shops from post office to bicycle shop to a small market open every day till sunset, and many shop people can speak a little English. Villa Borghese is no more than fifteen minutes walk distance, and the whole enjoyment of tranquility is there. The hotel people are quite charming too. Though you are male traveller, they will not despair you, instead they give you as good service as can be found at higher-rated hotels in Rome. The breakfast room is fine and serves good hot meal and steamed latte. My room was 108, on the first floor of the premise and was a fine queen-size bed room with minimalist, black and white main design, and with interesting view of the backstreet of Rome! The hotel guests were mostly Europeans and Russians who were very friendly. Overall this hotel is definitely a very good place to enjoy tranquility and no ordinary Anglo-tourist style of travelling!

Reviews.Title: “not flexible, poor customer relations”
Reviews.Author: benmeehan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and decorated to a high standard. However, the staff were, in my view, poorly trained in customer care. For example, a black American in the group was asked for his room number three days in a row while entering the hotel. He was very annoyed and considered this to be a racial slur. There was no cup on my breakfast table and when I asked for one, the member of staff walked down to ‘check my table’ (why would I lie) before going off to get me a cup. Silly, but irritating upsets due to a poor customer care ethos. Parking costs twenty five euros per night on top of the published rates which is not advertised and adds significantly to overnight costs. I asked to stay one night less then we had pre-booked through bookings.com which was pre-paid and was refused point blank. Overall, I was unhappy with my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception staff, microscopic room, comfortable bed, chaos at breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Hayse01
Reviews.Content: The reception staff here were great, really welcoming and helpful. The hotel has obviously been recently refurbished (don't be put off by the outside) and is trying to be boutique. The room was REALLY small (only booked a standard as one night stopover on the way the the airport) but the bed was lovely and comfortable with nice linen and soft pillows etc. Breakfast was hilarious, I think everyone must have come at the same time and the poor staff were overwhelmed, empty containers, queues at the coffee machine, total nightmare (obviously more staff needed with the amount of guests). Easy walking distance to colliseum and other attractions and the area is fine. All in all definitely OK and would stay there again for an overnight. Internet was chargeable but that is not unusual in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: 416YYZ
Reviews.Content: -Recently renovated - modern (but not too modern) rooms -Photos on Trip Advisor match exactly what we saw -We travelled carry-on only and walked to the hotel from Termini (the main train station) after our flight (it would be a cheap taxi ride from Termini - by Toronto-standards) -You wouldn't want to walk from Termini with anything more than one carry-on bag -Some have commented that it's too far from attractions; however, five minute walk to the Borghese gallery and much nicer than staying near to Termini (who wants to stay near a train station?) and calmer than the core tourist zone -We are used to a fair bit of walking and often strolled from our hotel to the tourist-hub -We probably strolled to the Spanish Steps in 30 minutes -We taxied from the Forum in under 15 minutes -Lots of taxis and buses nearby, if you need them (including an airport taxi stand) -Bank nearby -The nicest reception staff I have ever met at a hotel -Reception speaks English perfectly, other staff (eg. porter, maids) do not speak much English -Exceedingly pleasant, friendly, accommodating and always gave us good advice -We saw two rooms during our stay; both were very similar and it seems quite certain that the room standard is high throughout the hotel -Our 4th floor room faced Via Brescia and had a balcony just big enough for standing and a better view than the lower floor room we saw -It might be worth asking for a room that faces Via Brescia (the hotel is on a corner) -Not all rooms have tubs; some are shower-only -Wonderful hot breakfast buffet and we didn't get tired of it for a week (although it is the same every day) -The breakfast area is large and attractively designed, and the buffet is never allowed to look "tired" -The food is brought out in suitable portions so that it doesn't sit for long -Tables are very promptly cleared by staff dressed for a white table-cloth restaurant -As usual with hotels, linens are changed every other day (I was a little surprised when they didn't change linens the day before we checked out since that was a linen-cycle day-3. I guess they figured we were leaving the next morning anyway.) -Rooms are clean -In-room safe in the closet -Mini-fridge in the closet -Beds were large and the rooms we saw were neatly filled by the bed and desk but not crowded (it's Rome, I don't think you'll get much bigger, really) -Wide staircases -Small elevator (very typical of what we saw elsewhere) -No street noise -A little bit of noise from the neighbouring room's shower/tub -You can purchase internet time for the computer in the lounge (we didn't bring a laptop, because it was a holiday!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location is "iffy"”
Reviews.Author: OphirBY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fiume for 3 nights. The hotel is very pleasant, modern, clean and comfortable. The rooms are well appointed with hardwood floors, an air condition system that actually works, a flat screen TV, free Wi-Fi, comfy beds and much more. The staff is very friendly and took from their time to help us with anything needed. Breakfast is continental but plentiful with anything you might want or need - vegetables, breads, eggs, four types of juices, espresso machine, etc. The one down side isn't really a down side, but should be taken into consideration - the hotel is located in the northern part of Rome and so you'll need to catch a bus to wherever you are going, although with a 15-minute walk you can also find yourself at the center of Rome, ready to see all the major sites. If you plan to us the bus, look for one of the kiosks that sell bus tickets and get the "day pass" for 4 Euros. Makes very good financial sense.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BexsH
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were a little put off by the outside but as soon as we went into the lobby we were happy. I would recommend the hotel. Two minutes walk and you can catch buses to all over Rome so it was very convenient. The staff were friendly and the room was large aand modern. The aircon was powerfull but not loud. Our "double bed" was really two singled joined together but this is not too uncommon in Italy. For breakfast there was a wide choice but for UK folks, no decent sliced bread for toast :o)

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pcbunter
Reviews.Content: a very nice hotel with good location and helpful english speaking staff.rooms not very large but beds very comfy and big.breakfast was excellent especially the fruit on offer.all in all a very good hotel beside plenty of restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahG89
Reviews.Content: Before I booked the hotel, which was a gift from my boyfriend for my 21st birthday, I read reviews made by previous guests, some of them said that all the attractions are only 10 minutes walk away, now this is half true as the walk is to the metro station and then you need to use the metro from there onwards. We found the metro very easy to use as they only have 2 lines and the Colosseum is only 2 stops away. The hotel is lovely and very modern, the noise on the streets can be a bit loud during the day and night but the windows are sound proof so we had no problem with that. Also there is Sky TV in the rooms and besides the news channel everything else is in Italian or so we thought after 2 days of watching Italian TV (which we cant understand) we realized some of the channels can be changed back to their original language (English) so definitely ask the front desk how to do that. The breakfast in the mornings was lovely (esp. the croissants) but that is the only food they serve during the day and staff seemed very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if I was to go back I would stay again. P.S. the lift to the rooms is absolutely tiny and the door in it doesn't close properly, I found it very funny.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: divineScotland
Reviews.Content: i read reviews of this hotel before we booked and it seemed too good to be true but i was pleasantly surprised. the rooms and public areas were spotlessly clean and the breakfast though typically continental was more than adequate. the hotel`s location was fairly central though to walk everywhere you would have to be able to walk more than a few kilometres a day. we walked to the colosseum one day, the trevi fountain one day and as far as the vatican city on another. however the day we toured the vatican museum, we took the tram which was cheap and easy to use - you could buy tram tickets at reception - one euro per journey of 90 minutes or less! rome is like any other city - exhausting if you want to see everything and i would reccommend this hotel as the rooms were quiet and comfortable. the air-conditioning worked really well and there was always plenty of hot water - the shower was like a deluge! one thing - there is very muted lighting in the ultra modern bathrooms and it`s difficult to apply make-up properly! a word of caution - we were charged 20 euros for a taxi from the station, a journey which should have cost less than 10. naturally this made us cautious about using taxis during our stay as this taxi-driver managed to somehow set his meter to run fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Seeker707
Reviews.Content: The tiles glitter when you walk in and the art hanging on the walls is beautiful. Those are the first things I noticed when I walked into the Hotel Fiume. The second thing I noticed was the smiling face behind the desk. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is great! The room was a little small and smelled weird, but when we told the gentleman – Alejandro – about it, he immediately got to work finding us a new room, which was available immediately! He also gave us a great restaurant suggestion, which was a minute walk away from the hotel. He was extremely helpful! The room itself wasn’t huge, but it was a decent size and extremely clean. There is enough closet space to hang a few jackets and dresses. Also, the black out curtains and shades are AMAZING! I cannot sleep with any light coming through and these did the trick. I thought I was waking up at 3am and it was 10am! Perfect. Also, they have wifi (5 euro for a continuous 24 hours) and a small library of books, which I love to see when I get to a hotel. The only downside is that it is quite a walk from the center of town. I believe there is a metro nearby, but we chose to walk every day because we had the time and wanted the exercise. However, it is very close to the train station (about 12 euros via taxi), which was nice if that’s the way you are coming to Rome. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quite stylish little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexMalmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. A fresh, clean and cosy hotel. Ok breakfast with a lot of choices. But the rooms were small. Our first room was the smallest double room I ever have entered, almost smaller than a cabin on a boat! We changed room in the morning for a larger room that was more adequate and had nice street-view. The area is not central downtown but had it´s upsides. First, the area is full of good non-touristic restaurants that are full of italians in the evening. Try some restaurants in nearby Via Sicilia. Secondly, there are several buses to downtown/Stazione Termini. And if u like walking, just follow Corso d´italia for 10-15 minutes to end up in Villa Borghese and Via Veneto where it all starts... Piazza Fiume also sports a large department store (Rinascente) In all, a very good hotel, just make sure u get a fairly large room from the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fiume”
Reviews.Author: lick17
Reviews.Content: Everything that is said about this hotel is true. It is in a very handy location - on the outskirts of central Rome. The buses nearby are very easy to use. The hotel itself is decorated tastefully with boutique style touches - gold gilded mirrors in the bathroom, fantastic rainfall shower heads and tasteful wall paper. The breakfast was lovely, fresh fruit, pastries, breads, cold cuts, cereal and freshly squeezed orange juice. The reception staff were friendly and incredibly helpful. I would definitely stay here again. On the down side the small "pool/jacuzzi" on the roof terrace wasn't filled but I think it probably wasn't warm enough to use it and our terrace/balcony was hemmed in on all sides by the building so wasn't in any way scenic but it did let some much needed air into the room as the hotel did not have the aircon on and the room was a bit stuffy. None of these things adversely effected my perception of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: brown812005
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for 7 nights ... the room was impecable on my return always, great breakfast,great stuff. Never have been into a hotel with such clean rooms. The hotel is quite posh and cosy. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MareaLaoutari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fiume for 3 nights and we loved our stay there. The room was big, the bathroom was excellent, it had a balcony (although the view was not good). The reception suggestions for restaurants or taxi rates was not according to our expectations, but that was just the only thing we did not much enjoy. We asked for a taxi to take us to the Outlet stores 30 miles outside Rome, and the rates they provided to us was too high (and they did not offered alternative options). So we found a taxi driver to take us there for half the price (by the way, ANGELO, our taxi driver) was THE BEST!!! He actually became a friend of ours! Otherwise, FIUME is an excellent option, it's chic and modern, it offers a good breakfast, it is not far away from the center of Rome. GREAT STAY. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised--great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor once again steers us right! Part of the reason I feel compelled to write reviews and return the favor to others. We found this on tripadvisor, and the photos by the individuals were the most useful--realistic and "undoctored." This hotel is just as advertised by these reviews. It is not in a central location, but the beauty of that is that you are in a non-touristy part of town. All the trattoria that we went to were filled with locals; we were the only tourists. It was great. You get a real feel for Rome and its food when you eat in local establishments. Many servers did not speak English at all. The rooms are super-clean and they have an electronic safe. The bathrooms are tiny, but the shower is luxurious. The rooms themselves are tiny. Not as small as some of the ones we stayed at in Paris, but they are expectedly small. We had a balcony, and that was nice. They have TV with digital access and multiple channels. The bed was as comfy as any Westin Heavenly bed I've slept in. Room service was excellent, and the place is spotlessly clean. The breakfast is good, but not great. We've had better breakfasts elsewhere, but it's totally fine. It is the same food every day, but it is okay. Cakes, croissants, eggs, bacon (italian version), cold cuts, juices, capuccino machine, cereal, canned fruit. By the way, the internet is not free. It is 5 Euros/24 hours on your laptop. The computer in the lobby is 5 Euros for 60 minutes. The location is fine to get to all parts of Rome. There are tons of buses that take you everywhere, and you very quickly learn the bus system of Rome. It is very easy to use, and no matter what part of town you're at, you learn how to get to another part all with public transportation. It was actually really fun. We paid approximately 100 Euros per night for 1 week. It was a great hotel, and we are grateful to Tripadvisor for steering us here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - fantastic breakkie”
Reviews.Author: FlickMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is spotless and the breakfast was amazing. Good value for money. Although not in the heart of rome, it is so close to metro and you can always walk - which we did a lot of. Good restaurants and bars close by too. Great rooftop to drink prosecco in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nicely furnished, great juicer”
Reviews.Author: lemkinn
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but a bit far out of the centre. However it is an easy bus ride to wherever you want to go. Breakfast is a bit of a scramble, with an extremely loud juicer that is in pretty much constant use. Rooms are small but very clean and nicely furnished. The area is pleasant. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Castelldefels
Reviews.Content: I was worried that despite the good reviews in Tripadvisor, the hotel would be far from city centre and underground but there were many buses near (1 min) and they are much better than the underground to go to the city centre. A four-star hotel including breakfast for 100€ in Rome was beyond my imagination and the breakfast buffet was great with orange juice, tea & coffee, fruit, ioghurt, croissants, etc. The room was a bit tiny but ok 'cause the bed was huge and extremely comfortable. All modern and new, in a non-touristic neighbourhood, which meant quiet nights to sleep and good restaurants full of Romans near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLC7279
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on both the front and back end of a Mediterranean cruise. Quite reasonable rate. Both rooms we had were fairly small but well-appointed. Great service from the desk. Superior breakfast. Close to many major attractions. My wife and I are walkers and could do several in a day. I based our booking on what others on Trip Advisor had to say about this hotel and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, just a little far from the centre - there's always the Metro though!”
Reviews.Author: Wifey_09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon and were plesantly surprised by the lovely reception area. The staff were welcoming and were happy to change our twin bed set up for a double (even though we asked for a double initially?). Our room was really nice, albeit on the smallish side but it had lots of storage and a nice bathroom. The decor was very nice and very modern. Breakfast here was also very nice with a good choice. Only small thing was that the hotel advertises a small 'pool' on the roof which wasn't filled at the time we were there despite it being very hot the whole time! I'd happily stay here again. The hotel is about 10 minute walk from the nearest metro station which then gives you access to the city and all its glory.

Reviews.Title: “Ohh if the rooms wern´t so tiny...”
Reviews.Author: Dado_de_Castro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, very beautiful decor, nice breakfast. The location could be better, but it is within walking distance of everything! Our 2 main problems were: - as it was the end of september the cooling was off and the heating on, so it was very hot in the rooms, and it took them 2 nights to resolve this problem, - and the fact that the rooms are very tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel recently refurbished”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGal73
Reviews.Content: The main photo for this hotel must be very old. Nothing in the hotel looked dated. Definitely look at the other photos submitted for accurate images. This was our favorite hotel in Italy. We got a great deal online - paid half the asking price by pre-paying for the room (but still more than I would pay for the hotel in the US - Italy is just expensive). The room was finished in a contempary feel. Small room, but nice. We stayed in a double room on the 2nd foor (considered the 3rd floor in the US). Bathroom had contemporary and beautiful glass tile. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy, American foods and European dishes served buffet style and included with the price of your room. Fresh fruit, eggs, canadian bacon, toast, rolls, danishes, cereals, fresh juice, milk, coffee. The bed was firm - seems to be a commonality among all hotels in Italy. You'll want to keep the windows shut at night due to street noise - I don't think you'll avoid this no matter where you stay in town. No screens on the windows, just shutters and mosquitos might be an issue, Italy seems to have a lot of them. I don't know that we had any mosquitos in Rome, but we did in all the other cities we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: TraipsingAround
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Fiume on the last night of our 10 day trip. We chose it because our other nights in Rome were on the otherside of the city center. It is a short walk to Babbo's, the #1 rated restaurant in Rome (which is unfortately closed on Mondays we found out upon arrival). It is a short walk to the Trimani wine bar too, yum! The location is not that close to all the major sites, but we had already hit those. It is near the Aurelian Wall and the Villa Borghese Gardens. The hotel's renovations appeared to be complete b/c we did not see any work being done. It was very clean and nicely decorated. Our room was small (it's Italy), but very clean and modern. The shower was very small, but the water pressure was great. The rooftop terrace was cute, we brought our wine up there and enjoyed our evening. The breakfast was just okay. The bacon looked raw, and the eggs tasted like they were all yolk. But the coffee machine worked great (long line most of the time), there was a nice selection of breads and salami, juices... it worked. The staff was helpful. Upon check-in, we booked a taxi to the airport the next morning. It was a flat 50 euro and a mercedes sedan picked us up right on time! :) I would definitely stay here again if I am in Rome. It was a great deal for a nice establishment.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: EmmaCHull
Reviews.Content: After checking review sites before booking a break in Rome, we decided this hotel would be the best for what we were looking for... and it did not disappoint! We were told the hotel had recently been revamped and decorated. The reception is large and pretty, with plenty of seating and a small bar at the ,back of the room (usually with a friendly barman sat there waitng for your order!) One of the receptionists is a little bit miserable, and on a few occasions ignorant, but all the other staff were very welcoming and happy to help. The reception does have computers with internet access but I am not sure if they charge a fee for its use. The maid service is regular, all are very friendly and don't mind popping back at a more convenient time if it is too early for you. The sheets and towels were always clean, the bathroom was always cleaned to a high standard. We opted to have breakfast in with the price of the hotel. They do a continental buffet and there is something for everyone, even younger children have the option of cereals like coco pops, and nutella for their toast. They have lots of choice with fruit, bread, drinks (separate machine for hot drinks, and also a juicer), bacon, eggs, meat, cheese, croissants, sweet pastries.... the list is endless. The rooms were beautiful, very clean, they also have a safe in each room which is free to use and you just put your own madeup pin number in for your stay. The beds are comfy, great air con (very much needed in August!!!) great view from the little balcony, flat screen t.v, minibar. There was also a roof garden but unfortunately I didn't get chance to go up and have a look but I am sure it would have been lovely if the hotel is anything to go by. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from a metro station, I would recommend buying a tourist ticket for 11 euros if you are there longer than 3 days, well worth the money! With this you get unlimited access to the metro, making it easier (and cheaper!) to travel across Rome. The hotel is also surrounded by great little restaurants! Overall, the only thing that let the hotel down was the one miserable receptionist! If he had cracked a smile the hotel would have been perfect. I would definately return to this hotel on my next visit to Rome. It is definately worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Girlwhofollowskarma
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Hotel Fiume and would stay there again. The service at the front desk was wonderful...the best we experienced in Italy! The clerks were so helpful and their English was excellent. The rooms were good-sized for Rome, a little worn, but renovations were in progress. Breakfast was excellent; we couldn't have asked for more. Better get a taxi or shuttle from the airport as it is a long way...take a bus from the rail station, though. Google a detailed street map if you use public transportation, as we walked in circles trying to find the hotel from the bus stop the first time. All in all, the Hotel Fiume is a great value, and we were very pleased with our stay in Rome, largely due to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: atrmt
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 nights at Hotel Fiume. We arrived on a Friday night by car and were a bit exhausted from the insane rush hour traffic. We were supposed to return our car to the airport that night but the concierge called our rental company and was able to find a much closer location for drop-off which saved us a 50 euro cab ride and at least 2 hours of our day. This was a great start to our stay in Rome. The rooms are modern, spacious (for Europe) and spotlessly clean. The hotel has been completely updated and includes a wonderful continental breakfast in their rate (I paid only $113 Canadian through Expedia!). It also had the most comfortable bed I slept in during my entire 2 week vacation. There is wireless internet available if you bring a laptop but there is also a computer available in the lobby for use. The hotel staff are wonderful and try to make your life as easy as possible. The location is a bit of a trek to the heart of Rome but we walked some days and took the metro on others (depending on how sore our feet were). Overall, this was an unbelieveable find. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value, great service!”
Reviews.Author: newlywedCanada
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, still in the midst of renovations but this did not cause any problems. Very friendly and helpful staff, good location (close to subway), fabulous breakfast. Modern rooms with balcony and mini bar (which we used for items bought at grocery store which was close by). Many places to eat nearby. Very quiet hotel and internet available for charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, just renovated!!”
Reviews.Author: fswalker
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at hotel Fiume. Hotel has just been renovated, they were just adding some finishing touches as we arrived. Location- nice quiet street, didnt find it particularly noisey, about 15min walk to spanish steps, and pantheon. We used metro once to get back from Vatican city. Hotel- brilliant breakfast, nice choice of breads, cold meats, fresh orange juicer, cereal, etc...all fresh and well replenished. staff - very helpful, organised taxi for us, assisted with recommeding restaurants etc. There are lots of trattorias near hotel which are all well priced and good food, there is a deli accross the road from hotel and small supermarket around the corner which we used to stock up on snacks for our room (there is a mini bar in rooms). All in all i would recommend this small hotel to anyone! it was such a relief to get away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas in the evening, and made dinning at night a lot cheaper!! hope to go back some day to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place, tucked away gem!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne20Sheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 3 night stay here. The place is undergoing refurbishment - our room was lush! - in fact I think we may have been the first to use it. There was a little noise from around 8am due to the works being carried out but we were up for breakfast by then anyway - just don't expect to a long lie in whilst they are renovating! There's a few nice restaurants nearby and a cosy bar on the ground floor, or if you fancy going into the city centre for dinner there a few buses which run regularly from he Piazza around the corner. Staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast was good too. This place comes highly recommended - very reasonably priced and tucked away from the busy tourist hotspots. It's well placed for the rail station too - approx. 10mins by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Fiume Hotel, Rome,”
Reviews.Author: cbsjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this 3 star hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is east of Villa Borghese area above the Corse De Italia. It is a bit off the center of town, but close enough to walk to the major train and bus terminal. This location made for a quiet location, yet close enough to many tratorias and small bistros. The Hotel had a very nice foyer, bar area and small lounge, no one was ever in these areas, but not because they were not inviting. A 1/2 flight up was an internet lounge with 6 or so computers for your use, again there was almost never anyone there. This area also had a tv and reading area. Another 1/2 flight up was the breakfast room. The breakfast was decent, nothing to rave about, but there was fresh coffee, capachino, tea, juices, etc. Plenty of bread and pastry as well as cerials, cold cuts, yogurts, fruits, crackers, snacks etc, as well as cold cuts ? I guess that's an italian thing. The rooms and other public spaces were all updated and very modern, The rooms were very good size, in comparison with other big cities, like New York and Paris. The bath was also a good size with a deep soaking tub. This was a very good choice as it was reasonable in cost, very clean, and a good location. The staff were helpfull and everyone was fluent in English. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough!”
Reviews.Author: Vianni911
Reviews.Content: I think many people do not give this hotel enough credit! After reading multiple reviews, my boyfriend and I weren't sure what to expect! We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is only a 3 star hotel and it isn't the fanciest thing in the world, but our room was more than adequate! The bathroom was EXCELLENT with a nice BIG tub to take baths in after walking Rome and sweating so much! The breakfast was GREAT and they had a lot of options to choose from daily! Overall, a great stay and I would recomment this hotel to anybody! I would say the only downfall is that it is a little bit outside of the city... But to be honest, there were times where that WAS appreciated seeing as Rome is a busy enough city in itself! You can walk to the Metro station or just walk to the city center, we didn't hesitate to do so! Hope you enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: vakaciones
Reviews.Content: Excellent service for what the hotel advertised and price. Really good location to get to any of the most interesting places in Rome. Public transport such as buses and tube are also very close. Rooms were clean and breakfast were a feast everyday, something you need when visiting such an amazing town as it is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service at the Fiume”
Reviews.Author: DonaldSutherland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fiume hotel over the August bank holiday weekend. The service at the front desk was excellent from phoning for a taxi for us, to arranging a packed breakfast one morning so that we could go on an early morning trip, to advising on local transport, to faxing forms on request, nothing was too much trouble and was dealt with promptly with the all-encompassing 'prego'. Good English was spoken at the hotel by the front desk staff which we found a relief (as we spoke no Italian apart from the essentials -how to order two glasses of wine :o). Hotel Fiume wasn't centrally located but it was only approx one mile out of the city centre very close to bus stops (2 mins) about 10 mins walk to a metro station and only 10 mins walk to Borghese, a beautiful park with a marvellous museum. We walked into the city from the hotel and got to Republic square and fountains after about a twenty min stroll. Fiume hotel is in a pleasant neighbourhood with plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants on the doorstep and feels like real Italy rather than a tourist trap, which more centrally located hotels might suffer from. There was a nice buffet breakfast every morning from 7-10am with plenty of different types of food available which was very tasty . The only reason this hotel is not getting a full 5 stars is that although the rooms were pleasant and of a decent size, with more than adequate bathrooms, they were a little shabby and worn around the edges. I found that electricity points looked a bit 'dodgy' not all of them worked. We could hear our neighbours coming back to their rooms at night, the doors were old and quite thin. The hotel had been rated as 3 star in my travel agent - 'Thomson's brochure however, like tripadvisor says, it is more like a good 2 star with that level of facilities- our room had air conditioning, telephone, satellite TV, hairdryer, bath and shower, mini bar and safe. I would certainly recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and not expecting luxury, just adequate rooms and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: Libby37
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two centre break with Archers Direct in which Hotel Fiume was our Rome base. Although not centrally located( this meant it was quiet) it is however very well connected.The rooms were clean and spacious and air conditioned. The breakfast was to be recommended- plentiful with lots of variety. The yoghurt machine was so cute. There were at least three restaurants within walking distance Checco E Lina was very good , the food was delicious and homecooked. We walked a couple of blocks to pick up the Rome circular opened topped bus and got off at different stops to sight see. Taxis were reliable and reasonable ate in the Trastevere and only about 12 Euros to get back. For shoppers, the department store Rinascentre is a stone throw away and had a sale on whilst we were there. The coffee shop on the top floor was great and afforded good views of that part of the city. The hotel is very close to The Villa Borghese which is great to allow kids to run around although you could hire bikes as well. A good base to sight see with out costing the earth. We also took a trip to Tivioli with Vastours a beautiful medieval town; tour included visited Hadrian's Villa and the amazing fountain gardens of Villa D'este- a photographers delight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrewMDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I can't say much except that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this fine hotel. Decent spacious rooms, reasonably priced for Rome, friendly staff, and a great free breakfast. I liked the location - a nice quiet part of the city fairly close to the metro; however if you are looking for somewhere closer to the tourist attractions this may not be the hotel for you. And bear in mind that Rome does not have a very extensive metro service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: JennyDurham
Reviews.Content: stayed in Hotel Fiume in June 2008, I would say it was very clean except we did have a family of ants in the bathroom that only seemed to come out on a night for a short while. Also the tea/coffee making machine for breakfast is not very kind to the tastebuds!!. The best thing about the hotel is the staff, they are extremely friendly and always available for advice on getting around rome, they also give you free maps which are very detailed, so its not hard finding the attractions. The bus stops are around the corner, bus 62 is great for visting the Vatican and going to the Trevi Fountain etc. The Metro is a short walk maybe 10mins, this is great for visting the Colosseum. The open top bus is a must, go for the 110 which comes every 5 mins! There are resturants next to the hotel, we went twice to one ran by two brothers, it was on the expensive side but the food was worth the price and we did not spend much money during the day as the attractions where supprisenly cheap, maybe around or less than 15 euros each. There are tours which will allow you to skip the line however we chose to hire the audotapes (but you must bring a passport for a deposit) as they are cheap and you can take your time. One warning though watch out for pickpockets, expecally on the buses and metros as they are very crowded. Overall the hotel is ok for somewhere to sleep whilst in rome, just like any 3 star hotel i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for exploring Rome on a budget”
Reviews.Author: hulahula17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 4 nights at this hotel with my uni friend Sam. We were quite concious of what the hotel would be like due to having stayed in some noisy and pokey places previously! On arrival we were overwhelmed by the size of our room- it was massive. It was nicely furnished and the beds were comfy-ensuring a great nights sleep (it was also nice and quiet). The hotel is located near a wide range of traditional restaurants so eating out was a pleasure. The breakfast range was continental and was the same every day but you can eat as much as you like. The staff were generally nice and accomidating to our needs. We would not hesitate to stay in the hotel again, as the main metro station was within walking distance so exploring Rome was easy and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “What a breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: catchinbadguys
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good- the lobby is so warm and inviting, the staff was very helpful, (although not very good at pointing out the bus stops to various locations) and the breakfast was the best of all three cities we visited- a huge assortment of food with fresh choices. The room was small of course, but okay. There is a fresh produce market at the end of the street with an amazing espresso bar inside- you MUST visit this when you come.

Reviews.Title: “Roaming in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cdb49
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fiume is situated about 5 minutes by bus from the city centre. The bus stops are a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. The room was quite spacious, with minibar, and the bathroom very adequate. I would highly recommend the buffet breakfast, hot and cold. To enjoy Rome at it's best be prepared to walk, walk, walk. It is quite a compact city with all the major sights within walking distance of each other. I would recommend out of season breaks as there is hardly any queing for the Vatican nor the Sistine chapel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: SheilaBmusic
Reviews.Content: Our group of 42 was booked into Hotel Fiume for 5 nights at the end of our 9th music tour of Italy. It was a new neighborhood for us, and everyone was very pleased. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and went the extra mile for us. The breakfast buffet is superb, and the only thing that would make it better is a real coffee source, not the push-button coffee-maker. Internet access is available in the hotel lobby (wifi also available in the lobby). Easy bus transport to everywhere in the city (we needed to get to Termini, the Vatican, S. M. Maggiore, and Piazza de Venezia). Many in our group used the RomaPass, which was excellent value and made for easy traveling without fishing for change or tickets. Good eats nearby: Checco e Lino (v. Brescia), Trattoria Il Padovano (v. Bergamo), Gelateria di Bruno (v. Nizza). Quicky & Cheap: Trattoria di Giuseppe (v. Bergamo). Do not eat at Ostaria dell' Arco (v. Giacomo Pagliari) -- while the food is creative and delicious, the service was beyond abysmal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Name99
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel Fiume for a 5 day trip to Rome as a romantic break and it was fabulous.
