It is further out of the way than some hotels, but this means more peace and quiet when you want it - and with all bus routes available nearby and friendly reception staff armed with maps we had no problems getting around everywhere. Breakfast was delicious and served in a lovely bright room, we never felt rushed - and the hotel bar was even good value, 5 euro for champagne cocktails (made with great care by the fabulous Ivan!) Rome is a fabulous city and I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LondonMe81
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Fiume for 4 nights last week. The hotel was exactly what we expected for a 2 star. The rooms are decent sized, fairly comfortable beds, and clean. The breakfast in the morning was actually pretty good. The hotel is about a 15 min. walk from most of the sites. We took taxis everywhere as we found they were not too expensive. The reason we would not stay at Hotel Fiume ever again lies with one of the employees at the front desk. He was horrible. Our first day there a group of women asked him a question, to which he rudely told them the desk was closed.....even though he was standing there doing nothing. He showed no manners or class. The times we had to ask him something he was rude and showed no interest in the job. Why work in a hotel if you so obviously do not like dealing with people?! Also, prior to arriving I emailed someone at the hotel to have a taxi waiting for us at the airport. He charged us 70 euros to drive us to the hotel. On our last day we decided to take a taxi from the local taxi stand just up the road (as we found 70 euros to be a bit much). That taxi driver charged us 30 euros! We were completely ripped off the first time! This is such an insult as the hotel booked that taxi for us. Finally, the walls at Hotel Fiume are paper thin. If you don't want to stay awake listening to those in the next room snoring all night then this isn't the place for you. Rome is such an amazing city. We loved every minute of it. We will definitely be back, but never to Hotel Fiume.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Lilaki1
Reviews.Content: After previous bad experiences in Italian and French hotels, I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel Fiume. Pros: Our room was a good size (especially for a European hotel) and the bathroom clean. The staff was helpful (I asked for directions and recommendations almost daily) and the breakfast that was included was fantastic! Cons: The walls are fairly thin, so I could hear our neighbor snoring and the child across the hall crying. It is also somewhat out of the way, so you can't really walk to any of the major sites. however, once we learned the walk to the Termini station, we would walk there (about 15 minutes) and then take a bus or subway to our desired destination. All in all, a great experience - just wish it was closer to the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: onnoq
Reviews.Content: A nice, reasonably priced hotel in a very good location. A bit too far away from major tourist sites to walk, but very good bus connections. Very nice neighborhood with a huge number of non-tourist restaurants. We had a very small room with a large terrace (it seems that rooms 470, 472, and 474 have this) that would be great during summer nights. Breakfast was far above Italian standard but coffee was far below (from a full automatic self-service machine). Our room looked like the last refurbishing was done by a non-professional, but everything was clean. We paid about 83 Euros (4 nights at the price of 3) for a double including breakfast and at this rate I would strongly recommend Hotel Fiume.

Reviews.Title: “A real jem”
Reviews.Author: caggieIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real jem the rooms are basic and it is in a little need of repair however the staff and lovely breakfast make up for it! While there a friend became unwell and needed hospital treatment the staff pulled out all the stops to translate to the medical team and arrange medical treatment. This service ment the world to us and i couldn't thank them enough for there help and kindness. My only critisim of the hotel is the noisy plumbing it can be noisy if the room next door have a shower appart from that excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fiume - Book it!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkidru
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Hotel Fiume, it was a great hotel, very clean, the room was basic but we hardly there anyway. Theres so much to see and do, the breakfasts we good you could have eggs and bacon which was a real surprise. The Hotel staff were very helpful and very professional, the location was good as in a quiet area, you could hear a pin drop at night! A couple of stores around the corner that sell cheaper drinks and snacks etc. Book this Hotel with confidence!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grecofan
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased to have booked this hotel - although it isn't central it is well-placed for public transport and the level of service provided was impressive for a 3* hotel. It is just about walkable to the city centre, but if you've been on your feet all day it probably won't feel like that! Our room was quiet (at the back of the building) and although not capacious was roomy enough for us with a small balcony which we weren't expecting. The room decor could do with a spruce up, but it wasn't poor by any means. The inclusive breakfast was served in an airy breakfast room just off the reception area and was plentiful and varied. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and polite: the 4 guys working reception were all very knowledgeable and although we didn't need them to do so for us, I heard them offer to book attractions for guests on several occasions. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet, Peaceful place.”
Reviews.Author: ladydaniela
Reviews.Content: My fiance, my sister and her boyfriend stayed at Hotel Fiume for two nights this past week, and I can heartily recommend this hotel for a stay in Roma. It is true that it is a bit far from the big sites although it is close to Villa Borghese. however, if you are into walking, you can make tracks to all the great places, perhaps with a ride on the metro. The fridge was wells stocked, the bathroom loaded with supplies I did not expect to find (combs, toothpaste, nailfiles) and the concierge was extremely friendly and helpful!! They inquired as to our departure date and time, and offered to call a taxi for us to arrive at 730am. They asked all the appropriate questions and got us a taxi big enough for our luggage. The colazione is included in the price of the room, and it was lovely. Eggs, bacon, cold cuts, fabulous bread, jam, yogurt, granola, toast, juice and sweets. THe only thing that I didn't like about it was that they use a coffee dispenser for all the coffee, cappucino and steamed milk, and that was a bit of a downer. No problem tho, because there are tons of fabulous cafes around the corner. We went to a great restaurant called Al Chianti, which was quiet and had a very authentic feel to it. And there are many other restaurants and pizzerias within steps of the hotel. There are a few bars within a few blocks of the hotel as well, for a fun nite out. Also within two blocks is a supermarket, and a modern movie theater, if you are in the mood for cinema. For 5 euros you can buy an hour on the internet on the computer right in the lobby. Also there is a bar, and lots of info on what to do in Rome. I really liked this hotel! It's simple and nice.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: RKMosley
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Fiume and enjoyed our stay. The room was small for the two of us; we had to open our suit cases on the bed. We had a lot of luggage because we were spending a total of 18 days overseas. The price was definitely good at 124 Euros/night. The bathroom had a pedistal sink so there was minimal room for toiletries. There was only a shower, but it had great water pressure and we never ran out of hot water. The room was very clean, although you could see the wear and tear on the wall paper. We had a small balcony which was a nice place to have a cup of coffee or, in my husband's case, a cigarette. The staff was very helpful in terms of recommending places to eat, providing a map of the area and answering general questions. I was very impressed with the cleaning staff - we left some Euros on the dresser (not thinking) and left for the day. When we came back, they were still there! That would never happen in the US - the cleaning staff would assume it was a tip. The continental breakfast was great - it was much more than what Americans expect from a continental breakfast. They served scrambled eggs, ham, cheese and cold cuts as well as the traditional pastries, cereals and juice. It was more than enough to fortify us for our sightseeing in Rome. Overall, the experience with the hotel was very positive. I would mention that given the hotel's location, many shops and restaurants are closed in August. It's in Northeast Rome, away from the major tourist areas which is great, but during the traditional Roman vacation time, we found a lot of things closed (including the Mail Boxes Etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: becsta_decsta
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night trip to Rome and I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel Fiume i must admit. Found it really easy to get to from the Termini, less than 10 mins. Although our taxi man was erratic. Appearance was nice, although rooms were small but to be honest we were hardly in them. Toilet was bigger than we first thought and the shower pressure was really good. There was maid service everyday who made the bed and changed the towels. Breakfast is yummy, they have a wide selection. The staff were really friendly, and good with directions. They never got fed up with us asking them for information. The hotel isn't in the tourist areas which i thought was a bonus. Theres afew really nice restaurants which are really friendly and priced well. Found it really easy to get around. Walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Spanish steps. We took buses to the vatican and coliseum which we found really easy to use. Buses run really regularly in Rome so you won't be waiting long. I would really recommend this hotel, we'll definately be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem- middle aged couple”
Reviews.Author: adventurers35
Reviews.Content: The Fiume doesn't pretend to be anything that it isn't. It has a good location, about 30 minutes stroll from the central bus station and is surrounded by a variety of places to eat and drink, depending on how much you want to spend. The hotel is small, efficient and friendly. Breakfast was fine and there was a cooked option. There is not a lot more to say about it. We really enjoyed our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: frtnrgr
Reviews.Content: We're both teachers in England and were travelling for a week on a school break - this means that every travel package was expensive to start. We booked this because it was cheap and we figured at the end of day "hey it's Rome, you spend the entire trip outside" The Room: To begin, the bed was big and incredibly comfortable! Shower pressure was fantastic, at times it seemed the hot water wasn't great, but this was fixed by showering at night or before 9am. Breakfast: Good buffet, slightly repetitive after a week but better than paying at least 10 Euros elsewhere. Starts at 7 which is great if you want to take a day trip to Pompeii and get crackin early! Staff: Incredibly friendly and helpful - really good with directions speaking great English. You can buy an internet card for 5 euros, this is good for a total of one hour throughout your stay and the internet is fast. Location: Everywhere is within an hour's walk. Spanish Steps in 20 mins, Termini in 10 (once you get used to crossing streets without crosswalks) Closest metro we used was at Repulica about 10 minutes away. You can walk everywhere, but take the metro at least once to experience the true Rome! Misc. If you go to the Colloseum, buy tickets at Palatine Hill instead. This gets you into both and saves a tonne of time. Outside the colloseum there are 2 lines one left and one right. The one on the right is for people with tickets already - this helped us! Overall we loved everything about the hotel especially it's quiet location!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: love_to_travel47
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our requirments. The room was slighty shabby but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom very clean & well equipped with towels which were changed daily. The double glazing made the room very quiet though it did get warm at night as the a/c wasn't very efficient. The breakfast was excellent with many choices. The staff were efficient & helpful speaking good English. Although not central, the sights were all within walking distance and most amenities were close by. There were plenty of reasonably priced restaurants very close to the hotel. It was lovely to come back from a hard day sightseeing to have a shower & rest and not have to go too far for an evening meal. We had beautiful weather which added to the enjoyment of our five day trip & apart from the usual sights we loved the Villa Borghese with it's Galleria museum (tickets need to be booked in advance). The audio guide was well worth €5. Take advantage of the drinking fountains all over Rome where you can fill up your water bottle with nice cold water for free!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Fiume”
Reviews.Author: GTDT
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at Fiume hotel. Although, the room was small but had everything you need and the bathroom was well equiped. The staff was both friendly and professional. The location is great, far enough from the busy historical center but close to efficient public transportation. The Italian neighborhood is plenty of food stores, a very nice market and a variety of restaurants, in styles and prices. Great value, have a nice stay at Roma! Graciela. Tel- Aviv, Israel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_alex
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel! We stayed there for 4 nights, and it was perfect. Room was clean och cosy, and although we didn't have our window towards the road, it didn't matter at all. Breakfast is really nice, all kinds of choices both in drinks, bread, sweets, eggs and bacon.... Very generous and not at all the usual "continental breakfast" Staff is very friendly and helpful and we will definetely be going back. There are som really nice restaurants just a few minutes from the hotel that are genuine and cheap! Don't be scared of by the fact that the hotel is a bit from the main tourist streets, that's what makes the whole stay! And if you want to walk to the Vatican, which is all the way cross town, it takes about an hour... So it's not "off" at all, although it may seem like it on the map. Oh, and, taxi is really cheap if you don't feel like walking =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pulse90
Reviews.Content: A little gem! Very central and comfortable. Nice breakfast and rooms for the price. Staff very helpful with directions and sights. We were able to walk into the centre within 10 mins, Would suggest the open bus ride if it is your first visit to Rome as this will give you all the general locations of the main sights, then you can explore the rest on foot. Try Tokyo pizza on the same road as hotel although you may have to queue for a while, but well worth it. Would definitely stay here again and hopefully very soon. Enjoy.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: philatrav
Reviews.Content: Group of 10 stayed for 3 nights. Rooms were well appointed, with large baths, very clean. Breakfast was varied with many delicious options of pastry, fruit, eggs, cheese, yougurt, etc. Reception staff were pleasant and very helpful with bus information and restaurant suggestions. Location is near Porta Pia, easy access to all sights once you get acclimated, by bus or comfortable walk. Not at all touristy...Near good little restaurants, food and bakery shops, and a city market with indoor/outdoor stalls. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: domidog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fiume for 4 nights at the beginning of February 2007 after reading good reviews on Trip Advisor. We got an excellent last minute deal for a standard double room. We particularly liked the look of this hotel, as it is a traditional style Italian building. We booked return transfers to the hotel on line with Rome-Limousine-Airport, and paid 35 euros each way. We found this company to be prompt and reliable, especially as we paid them after they picked us up in a Mercedes! We arrived at the Hotel Fiume just before their check-in time of 2 o’clock and checked into our room on the third floor with no problems for being slightly early. The hotel has a very attractive, spacious lobby area with use of an Internet PC (for a fee) and a small bar. Our room was a reasonable size for a city room and was exceptionally clean. The bathroom complimentary toiletries were replenished daily, and were especially handy, as we’d forgotten to pack some of ours. The room also had a free, small safe that we paid a returnable deposit of 20 euros for. Our bathroom was new and had a powerful shower, hairdryer, and a bidet. Being early February and chilly at night, our room was always warm and fortunately, we always had hot water. Situated at the back of the hotel, our room also had double patio doors and full-length green wooden shutters that opened out onto a long Italian-style private balcony with window boxes and 2 plastic chairs. This would have been ideal to sit out on in the summer, although the view wasn’t the greatest, we felt like we were in Rome. The large breakfast room was very pleasantly decorated and breakfast even included boiled or scrambled eggs and bacon, and was more than adequate. Also lots of different hot and cold drinks to choose from, including squeeze your own fresh orange juice! Although very close to Porta Pia and Villa Borghese, the Hotel Fiume is located slightly outside the main tourist area, but don’t let this put you off, as it’s a very safe area to walk round and has lots of good restaurants. One evening, we walked to Via Veneto and ate at the Hard Rock Café, and felt completely safe walking back in the dark. All of Rome’s major tourist attractions are fairly close to each other, and armed with a good map, (the hotel lobby has a free one); we enjoyed walking to all of them from the hotel, including the Vatican, which took us under an hour walking slowly. (We are middle-aged and stopped to take photos!) Public transport is just around the corner if you don’t like walking. All in all, we had a very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Fiume. It provides a good base for sightseeing and we would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for a great hotel at budget prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterTourist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Fiume for 7 nights from the 27th of December 2006. We found the hotel to suit our needs. The staff are friendly and very helpful, recommending restaurants and explaining how to get to the tourist spots. A very good buffet breakfast is provided. Rooms are very clean and the furniture is in good condition. I would however agree with the other review that the decor is in need of refurbishment (ripped wall paper in places, lots of old bracket fixtures marks etc). But this did not take away from the quality of the hotel much. The hotel is situated in a residential area but is very near to key transport links on the Piazza Fiume. Lots of good local restaurants. We found however that all the sights are within walking distance, the furthest being about 30 minutes walk away (The Vatican). The main area to go at night for restaurants and night life is the Via Veneto, which again can be walked in about 20 minutes but is only a few minutes away in a taxi and cost about 6 euros. Taxis are cheap and the hotel can order them for you but be warned, when we arrived taxi drivers tried to charge 20 euros to get us to our hotel from the Termini. A complete rip off! The Termini is near enough to walk but personally I think a bit too far with a case so expect to take a taxi and pay about 10 euros. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Journey_man_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a good choice Great breakfast and well located. You can walk to the main Termini train station in 15 minutes. Room was ok considering the price and star rating so no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Just the spot”
Reviews.Author: Stottmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the weekend of the17th in November and found that it suited the bill perfectly. We met the male receptionist mentioned in another review but he was ok with us and let us check in earlier than we should after some watch watching, didnt see him again. In general the staff we met all spoke excellent English and were happy to do so. They were also very helpfull and informative, the barman escorted us to a local restaurant and showed us in, in addition the "taxi" we ordered to go back to the airport turned out to be more of a chauffer driven Mercedes, and only cost 10e more than the original journey. The hotel itself is located slightly away from the city centre and is more of a locals area instead of being full of tourists, making it perfect for a relaxing evening in the restaurants. The Metro system is 10-15 minutes away and easy to find once you get your bearings. This will take you to all the main sites but its best to walk once into the centre as everything is so close. The only down side is that the rooms while being a decent size are tired, everything is spotlessy clean and the maids do an excellent job. However, our room whilst being adequate did need decorating. But don't let this put you off as everything else makes up for it. Nothing to do with the hotel at all. When about the city keep your wits about you as Rome does have a reputation for pick pockets. Again, this is nothing to do with the hotel just some advise.

Reviews.Title: “Love Rome, but hotel......”
Reviews.Author: Steph20
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1pm, it was easy to find and within walking distance as long as you dont have heavy bags. We were greeted by a very dure male receptionist who told us to come back at 2pm. We were allowed to leave our bags and when we returned at 2:15pm we were given a room key. We found the room ourselves but it was still being serviced and instead of going back down 4 floors we waited. The room was so small as was the ensuite but it was clean. Our room was in need of decoration as was the ensuite, it hadnt aged well. When showering the water was luke warm to cold, not pleasant for November. The breakfast was fine, not particularily appetising but means to an end. There were a few good restaurants near the hotel which were lovely. Also the travel network was good and easy to travel to all the sights. Rome was great but the hotel could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and in a good authentic location”
Reviews.Author: URQUHART
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. What people have said is spot on - basic accomodation, but clean and in a good area. I got a matchbox of a room, but I paid bottom dollar and wasn't bothered. What really made my stay here was the cafe / restaraunt on Piazza Fiume call Mokarabia (although I think that may be just a brand of convenience around the city). Each day (except Monday) they have the most fantastic brunch I've ever seen between 12.30 and 2 that costs E6.50 or E7.50, with everything cooked fresh by the Napolitan chef who you'll see marching around giving orders. The owner's wife Alexandra is a former ballet dancer who speaks very good English and is usually sitting around happy to chat (if you're travelling alone as I was).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Coventry
Reviews.Content: Wanted a nice affordable yet quality hotel for me and my girlfriend to stay in on our 4 night trip to Rome. We wanted a good, well furnished, friendly hotel close to the centre of Rome but not too close ! Hotel Fiume fitted the bill perfectly. Its a 5 min bus ride to Termini (central train and bus station) which provides links to everywhere you could possible want to go in and around Rome. The bus stops are plentiful and can be found 100 yards from the hotel. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, the room was modern, spacious and very clean, with a nice balcony overlooking a small garden. The breakfast was also great. The surrounding are was good too. Plenty of shops and lots...and lots of good places to eat. You may come across the occasional bit of graffitii but thats just how Rome is. Its everywhere, dont let it put you off. The whole stay in the area was friendly and welcoming. Would def come back to Hotel Fiume.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in untouristy area”
Reviews.Author: bluesealover
Reviews.Content: If you are good with maps and directions, this hotel is for you. If you tend to go in the wrong direction like my mom would have without me, then you should find a hotel closer to a Metro subway stop or in a more touristy area. You will be using the bus frequently. We used the 90 Express bus (takes you to Termini if you want to hop on the subway from there) and the 62 (to Vatican City) from the Porta Pia stop which is near the hotel (not "next to the hotel" as one of the reviewers mentioned below) - it is actually a few blocks away. The buses are often crowded in the mornings due to locals going to work. I never saw a pickpocket. I believe because the hotel is in a very untouristy area and the pickpockets tend to hit those that are more tourist-laden. The hotel itself is nice and clean. The lobby is much bigger than the ones in the hotels we stayed at in other cities of Italy. The staff are very nice and helpful. They speak English. They can help you with directions, providing a map and telling you how to get to each location by bus. The taxi drivers went on strike two days before we were to leave and the desk manager arranged for a private driver to take us to the airport. It was 50 euros but worth it (the guy hit 50 mph on short city streets and going 90 on the traffic-packed expressway - didn't bother me, we got to FCO airport under 45 minutes in morning rush hour traffic). The room was quite small (much smaller than the other hotels we stayed at), but the bathroom was bigger. There was a deep tub (not good for those who have a hard time climbing in and out). There is a shower door that is like one foot wide and doesn't keep water out of the tub so often there will be a huge puddle on the floor if you are not careful! Plenty of towels provided. The beds were comfortable (much softer than the other hotels - those were rock hard!). There were extra pillows stored in the wardrobe. Everything is modern, the tv, the fridge, the bathroom. The wardrobe is big enough for two (there are two separate closets within the wardrobe). There is very little space to put your luggage, just one luggage rack, so while that was taken by my mom, I put mine on top of the cabinet that held the refrigerator. The door lock is tricky. When locking yourselves in the room, be sure to turn the knob until the door locks. The food is repetitive at best (same food we had at the other hotels before arriving to Rome). They do bring in fresh warm rolls from a local bakery. The biggest plus was the coffee machine. There are like five different choices of coffee, including cappuccino which I drank the whole time. The coffee was awful at other hotels and this was a nice surprise. The neighborhood is definitely untouristy. Lots of good and reasonably-priced restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cartersandtaylors
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fiume with friends for three nights, good location about thirty minutes to spanish steps and trevi fountain. Plenty of restaurants nearby if you come out of the hotel and turn right then right again we ate at la maremma pizza restaurant on left good value and always full. Left out of the restaurant and top of street is fiume square where you can get a taxi or the bus. I suggest you use the taxis because of pick pockets on the buses one of the people staying in our hotel had his wallet taken out of his pocket the money taken out and the wallet put back. A taxi to the colosseum cost twelve euros but beware of the Roman soldiers we had our photo taken and cost us ten euros. A taxi to St. Peters Square was just under ten euros. I would reccomend the hotel ,staff friendly rooms nice roof terrace for sun bathing with hot tub.
